required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prognostic Value of Rb-82 PET Myocardial Perfusion Imaging

brief_summary.textblock: The physician would like to see if nuclear cardiac stress tests can predict cardiac health. For example, if a patient has an abnormal stress test, is he or she more likely to have cardiac problems in the future?

primary_outcome.measure: correlate scan findings with clinical outcomes
primary_outcome.description: Patients will complete one questionnaire over the phone.

arm_group.arm_group_label: pts who have had Rb-82 PET myocardial perfusion imaging
arm_group.description: Eligible patients will have had Rb-82 PET myocardial perfusion imaging at MSKCC, 2008 - 2011. Patients will complete one questionnaire over the phone.

intervention.description: Patients will complete one questionnaire over the phone. We will ask patients to describe their cardiac history since Rb-82 PET (chest pain, shortness of breath, cardiac catheterization, and heart attack). This information will be correlated to the scan results and other relevant information in the patient's medical record.
intervention.arm_group_label: pts who have had Rb-82 PET myocardial perfusion imaging

study_pop.textblock: Patient with one or more 82Rb myocardial perfusion stress tests performed at MSKCC, 2008—2011.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient > or = to 18 years of age
- Registered patient at MSKCC
- Patient with one or more 82Rb myocardial perfusion stress tests performed at MSKCC, 2008—2011
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient is unwilling to participate

clinical_study.keyword: one or more 82Rb myocardial perfusion stress tests
